utterance.speaker: Collins
utterance.content: Good afternoon, Cedarville! It is my distinct honor to present our annual community service award to one of our most outstanding citizens. Now, many of you may recognize him as Coach Bob of our champion little league team. And some of you may know him as the treasurer of our Harvest Scholarship Fund. But I know that all of you know him as the guy that owns the only gas station in town. Bob Harris, get on up here with that beautiful family of yours! Bob Harris, folks! Bob, your community activism, charity work, and character represent the finest Cedarville has to offer. Please accept this on behalf of all of us and know that we love you.

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: Are you all right? Bob? You're crushing me! Wake up! I think you're having a heart attack. I'm gonna call the ambulance!

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: No. Just drive me to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: As the new dean of medicine, I'd like to personally welcome all of our new employees and ask, why the hell do you want to come back?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Tired of surfing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He hasn't changed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And neither has the job, right? We still get to do crazy crap?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Save people's lives instead of just their noses?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: About that… about the crazy stuff?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Here we go. He's gone from ally to enemy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He has no choice. He's the boss now. He has to be professional. He has to base his decisions on what's best for the entire hospital. We can't take it personally.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Couldn't have said it better myself.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You did. I'm just reading the notes on your desk. He also wants us to spy for him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not spy. I'm trying to keep House out of prison. To do that, I need to know what he's doing and planning.

utterance.speaker: Chase and Taub
utterance.content: Spy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Come on, guys. I am your boss. You do have to treat me appropriately. But it doesn't have to be awkward and weird. Outside of work, I still consider us all friends.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm glad you feel that way, because I do have a favor to ask. I told House I couldn't come back until next week. He said he understood completely and that I was fired. So… Since I have my kids for the next two days, I need a babysitter.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Male patient went into v-fib but shows no signs of heart disease

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What was he doing when his heart decided to do the mambo?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He said he was at work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're late.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: According to my calendar, I'm a week early.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Beard's a nice touch. Lets everyone know that you're not a teenage girl. Oh, now, you two make a cute couple. And you two… It's not important.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dr. Park. You're a lot taller than I thought you'd be.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And I look forward to working with you as well.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's lying, not just Taub… the patient. These abrasions on his knees… they're minty fresh… about ten hours old.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He got them playing flag football.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He said he got them playing flag football. I'm sure that's true if "flag" is a euphemism for "penis" and "football" is a euphemism for "entering a vagina."

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Why lie about it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everybody lies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Speaking of which, how are your two baby girls?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Wow, twins… congratulations.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Awkward! He knocked up two different women at the same time… At least he thinks he did. You have them DNA tested yet?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why would I? They look just like me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But they will grow. Find out what else he's lying about. Do an exercise test… see if you can get him to go back into v-fib again.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But we could end up causing another cardiac arrest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hopefully. Then we'll know what set it off.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He means it's better to do it here where we can revive him than have it happen somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The prodigal son has returned. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go slaughter a fatted calf for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I told you, I was sitting at my desk when the attack happened.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: These rug burns are from last night.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We think you were having sex, but memory loss could also be a symptom. Maybe we should ask your wife.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Don't. I-I did something stupid last night, but it was a one-time thing. You have no idea how bad I feel about it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Your guilt is between you and your wife. We just need to know what happened.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I was having sex at a motel when I started to feel light-headed. Next thing I knew, I was laying on my back. I could barely breathe.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: Is everything all right?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We'd like to perform an exercise test, re-create the stress that may have caused his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: He was sitting at his desk.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's his heart we're worried about. The test will monitor its rhythm so we can check for any abnormalities.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I spent a month in solitary. You don't think I can keep this up all day?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have a headache. Could you just lower your voice?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase and Taub are back!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You want me to pick up an ice-cream cake?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I also think that Taub has brought his little Taubettes into work with him today.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I didn't give him time to do anything else. Then I started wondering, who'd be sappy enough to watch them for him?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: They're not here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? I just came for a chat with a friend. What's that I smell, friend?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I understand your confusion. I was eating a baby for lunch, and… I have a massive migraine. Will you please just go away?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You should probably lie down and rest.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. I was trying to.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh! There is one more thing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's in too good of a shape. We need to get him to the point he was at last night.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Well, don't look at me. But if you want to…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cute. I didn't mean physical stress.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Don't you guys think this is irresponsible? It's like you getting two women pregnant at the same time. I just mean the part about the odds of it happening. They had to be incredibly high. And if we induce v-fib, odds say that we'll be able to revive him. But there's always a chance we can't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's extreme and reckless. That's House. You get used to it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or I fire you. Look what I found… Kiddie-winkies! I wonder who they belong to.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Give me my kids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. I genuinely wonder who they belong to. I need a DNA sample.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not letting you DNA test my kids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Already did. This swab's for you. Fine. If you don't mind paying a fortune in child support for some other guy's kids, no skin cells off my cheek.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: His heart rate's finally elevating.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: Dr. Chase said you had something to tell me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We were talking about how you got the abrasions on your knees… the flag football game.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Oh, um… Yeah, honey, I'm gonna need you to let the guys know I'm not gonna be able to play on Saturday.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: The whole town knows that you're in the hospital. I wouldn't worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's not what you wanted to tell her. You said the game wasn't typical. Something happened that you were upset about?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I don't understand. What are you t… I don't f… I don't feel very w…

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: What's happening?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not his heart.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know. He's having a seizure.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: There wasn't any abnormal electrical activity in his E.K.G. when his seizure occurred. It wasn't caused by a v-fib.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We still can't rule it out. His E.K.G. from the E.R. documented…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Myocarditis… viral infection weakening the wall muscles. We need to biopsy his heart to confirm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Myocarditis wouldn't cause a seizure.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Could be genetic… Brugada Syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Two prodigal sons. Come on. Let's hug it out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You really like the idea, or you just want to grab some hair for a DNA test?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a stupid idea. We would have seen evidence of Brugada in the E.K.G. You know, this is… this is just messing with my feng shui here. What about over there?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: A pheochromocytoma. Excess adrenaline can cause heart problems and… seizures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Boring!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I thought I was here to treat the patients, not entertain you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would it hurt to do both? Oh, this is much better! I said it was boring. I didn't say it was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So I'm right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. You're wrong. Photic epilepsy… it's equally boring, but it has the advantage of possibly being right. Give him an E.E.G. to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you ever hear me mention anything about wanting kids, please feel free to punch me in the liver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's like Satan's alarm clock.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's House up to? He hasn't asked me for anything. He's been incredibly well-behaved. He's doing his clinic hours.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That is a sign of concern.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And you know him as well as I do. He needs to constantly establish he's the Alpha dog.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's got his team back. He's got his office back. He's got everything he needs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You really believe that… He's content? I don't want to let House sabotage himself by sabotaging me, and I need your guidance and your trust to do that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, no, no. Cuddy had a problem with House, she came to me. Wanted to vent… me. How did that turn out? You have a problem with House, deal with it, or find someone else who can.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry about earlier, but we needed to provoke a reaction.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: It worked. I can barely look her in the eyes anymore.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'd want my husband to tell me the truth.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sure. You'll feel better, and she'll feel what… devastated, betrayed? Heartbroken. Do you really want to do that to her?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: No. But I can't live like this.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But she can. All set.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: All right, we need you to sit back and try to relax. Just look at the light.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What exactly are they building back there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A dream.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The E.E.G. didn't show any abnormal brain activity.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He doesn't have photic epilepsy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know, because he has a pheochromocytoma.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You said I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were wrong not to rule out epilepsy first. That only takes a couple of hours. Finding a tumor that's flushing adrenaline through his system is gonna take all night. Monitor his brain activity, start a continuous urine test and blood draws every two hours.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can't! I have my kids! Wilson's leaving in, like, minutes!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase and Adams can do the test.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For the massage bed. You and Park are checking the motel he was bumping uglies at for environmental factors.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He couldn't find a babysitter. Get over it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're gonna get us killed.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: She thinks I'm a prostitute on her turf. Showing weakness is what gets you killed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why would she think you're a prostitute?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm in a dump with a guy almost twice my age. What else is she gonna think?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How old do you think I am?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So who cheated on you?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We just met. Don't you think it's a little early to be dragging up our baggage in front of each other?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Who says I have baggage?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I know when House went to prison, you quit medicine. — You don't do that unless…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I didn't quit. I took a vacation. I knew when he got out, I'd get my job back.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: House didn't even know he was coming back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I had faith.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Now, that has baggage stamped all over it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Seizure activity?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. One of the sensors came loose.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'll fix it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Not a pheochromocytoma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Our patient now has a mass in his neck, and his body temp's been rising over the last three hours.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Where is the construction crew?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'm not gonna make them work day and night. So I chose night.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And his urine and blood tests didn't show any evidence of an adrenaline-secreting tumor.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Meningitis. We can do a lumbar puncture to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry. I had to drop my kids off at day care across town. What'd I miss?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not meningitis. His neck isn't stiff, and his mental status is normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's only guessing. I'm talking to Taub. He can't say "my kids" until he lets me test them. Tell me about the love shack where he cheated on his bride.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Quarters came in handy. My kids loved the massage bed.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Lab tests show the bed tested positive for, uh, semen, vaginal secretions, saliva, and fecal matter, both human and animal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably want to boil the kids for a couple hours when you get home.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The bathroom also tested positive for five different types of pathogenic bacteria.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fusobacterium necrophorum was one of them.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yeah. How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The bulge in his neck. The bacteria colonized his parapharyngeal space, moved into his jugular vein, causing a thrombus… Lemierre's Syndrome. Treat with amoxicillin and clavulanic acid. Take out the clot before it moves to his lungs and kills him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have at least a trillion cells. You're gonna misplace one of them eventually.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I have to tell my wife the truth.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: There's plenty of time for that after the operation.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: What if I die, and one day she finds out I cheated on her? I'll never be able to explain, never tell her how sorry I am.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're increasing the odds of that every second we waste here.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: No, I'm not agreeing to anything until I talk to her.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Hey. Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Sally
utterance.content: Ew! Your neck looks really gross.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I missed you both so much. But I need to ask you favor. I need to talk to mommy alone for a second. Would you mind watching them for us?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This guy's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think he actually has a good point. What would you think if you found out years later your beloved dead wife cheated on you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I wouldn't believe it. As long as I don't hear it directly from her, then I can hang on to hope that it's not true. But this way… she has to either dump him or forgive him.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: Guys, get your stuff. We're leaving.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: I'll be back. I'm gonna drop our kids off at my mother's. Look, he made a mistake… a stupid, horrible mistake. But we'll get through this. All I care about right now is that my husband gets better.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sorry about yesterday. House was like the child catcher from Chitty Chitty Bang Bang.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why is he so obsessed with my kids being my kids? Because he sees insecurity, and when House senses weakness, he pounces, and because his insecurity is the fact that other people can have faith and don't have the obsessive need for physical proof.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Also, he started a betting pool on which kid is yours and which isn't.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: An entire hospital betting on the legitimacy of my kids? It's great to be back among friends.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not the bad guy here. I'm betting on them both being yours. I would have donated the money to charity.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Approaching the clot. Stand by for…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That’s not a clot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's his lymph nodes. The bulge wasn't caused by pus or blood. It's tissue inflammation. How can there be that much tissue…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: …lymphoma. We need to take a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did I nick something?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't see any bleeding in here.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: His sclera's jaundiced. I think it's his liver. It's failing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We did a major operation for no reason. It's not Lemierre's Syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We would have had to biopsy his lymph nodes anyway to check for cancer.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Which it's not. Biopsy was clean.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We could be dealing with an alcoholic going through withdrawal. It explains his heart, seizures, and liver failing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But not his swollen lymph nodes.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Why are we stealing cable from here? We don't even have a TV in our office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm an ex-con, trying to adjust to a world that's passed me by. Stealing's all I know… that and the fact that I was right about what's wrong with our patient. Just wrong about what?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He means it's not Lemierre's, but it's still an infection, which is why it's spreading so rapidly.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Cultures take time, and his liver doesn't have much left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's why we're gonna blast him with broad-spectrum antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: The blast will fry what's left of his liver. The cure will kill him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not if we get him a liver transplant first and then treat him with a broad spectrum.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And old team for the win! Not that I'm keeping score. It's more of a grid where I assign numerical values to determine who gets raises, vacation time, and my respect.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We he him on the donor list for a liver. But these things take time.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: So he could die before he gets one.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's a possibility. But we have another option. We can do a partial liver transplant from a living donor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you're a match, but to increase our odds, we'd like to get your friends and family tested as well.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Is it safe?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's a major surgery. The donor spends a week in the hospital and up to three months convalescing at home.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I can't ask someone to do that for me.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: There are hundreds of people who would do that for you.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Because they don't know the real me.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: You are a good man who made a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Then I have to tell them first.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: I have to live with this too.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I know. And I'm sorry, but… this is the only way that I can do this.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Before I ask any of you to sacrifice three months of your life for me, I have a confession. I had an affair. I cheated on Denise. I wouldn't blame anyone if you decide…

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: I forgive him. That should be enough for all of us. Thank you so much for coming here…

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: There's more. Larry… that new transmission I put in your truck… you didn't need it. Joe, same thing with the engine rebuild. In fact, I cheated most of you here tonight. Half the time you bring your cars into my garage, there's nothing wrong with them. I've been ripping you all off for years. I also took $10,000 from the harvest scholarship fund, and I lost it gambling. I'm sorry. I'm not the man you thought I was.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That went over well.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Out of the two donors who didn't walk out, both were negative for a potential match. Telling the truth may have just killed this guy.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I told him to tell his wife he cheated, not confess every sin he's ever committed.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If everyone did that, we'd never find a donor for anyone again.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Everybody doesn't lie, cheat, or steal from their friends.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, they do. Maybe not as much as this guy, but if people told nothing but the truth, the world would probably burn down overnight.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Some people think it's burning now. Maybe if everybody didn't lie…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aw, that is cute. I'm talking about your breasts. They always get perky when you're being painfully earnest. Truth. It's uncomfortable, isn't it? More truth… I only noticed because Chase was staring at them. He'd never admit it, because he doesn't want to offend you. Same reason he'd never tell you that he's thought about having sex with you. Although, to be fair, every man you've ever met has thought about having sex with you. They'll lie, because if you knew… you probably wouldn't want to have sex with them. And that's just some of the lies from the last minute. And here's a bigger one… you already know this, but you pretend you don't because it makes you feel civilized. Most people find it easier to ignore the truth. Ask Taub. Our patient can't wait for a transplant that's never gonna come. We need to get reckless and extreme. C.T. his liver, find the damaged area, and cut it out. Hopefully, what's left will be enough so we can start treatment with broad-spectrum antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sorry the first time I had both of you together I had to work. But daddy's boss is what we call a jackass. Good. Stay right there. I'm also sorry… for what I'm about to do… because… because nothing will ever change how I feel about you guys. But… but daddy is weak and needs to know.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay. Just gonna put this right here… okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's 3:30 in the morning. Why are you still here?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House is here and apparently prepping for an operation that will probably kill a patient.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I wouldn't be doing this if I thought there was another way.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There is. He needs a transplant.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You have one lying around? 'Cause he'll be dead if he doesn't get one in the next few hours.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That falls under natural causes. If you kill him, we're looking at…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dead is dead.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not as far as our lawyers are concerned. I'm not being a dick. This is a real issue, and I have to worry about the big picture now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't. I'll be doing what you would have done a year ago. I'll be in surgery.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Chase… you need to check this out. This is a C.T. scan of his liver from ten hours ago… this is from now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's healing itself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When I left the room, he was telling her about the strippers from his bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Liver function has improved 30%… buys us a few extra days before he'll need a transplant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting question is, why is it regenerating?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And scene. Now we're back to boring reality reality. His liver was in shock before. He's been having an allergic reaction since he got here.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could explain why his symptoms appeared so rapidly.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And maybe starting to go away.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need to run a scratch test to find out what set it off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or who. This all started when he cheated on his wife.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's allergic to a person?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or something she's wearing… makeup, perfume, birth control method, her "Hello Kitty" doll. Two of you go find her and find out what. Two of you start treatment with corticosteroids and epinephrine while you run the scratch test.

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: You think I did this to him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Or something you wear, own, use, or gave him.

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: I gave him a condom. He didn't have one.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What kind?

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: I don't know what kind. I got it from the health fair I was working at.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're in the medical profession?

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: I'm Miss Cedarville. The health fair is one of my responsibilities.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Is another one hooking up with 38-year-old married men?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I guess I'm supposed to be the good cop. I know this is tough. But anything you can remember might help save his life.

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: He was giving me a ride home, and… he always seemed so nice. And then we ended up at the motel. And now everybody's talking about it. And if they find out it was me, I'm gonna lose my title and probably my job. And no one in town is ever gonna speak to me again. I made a mistake, and now it's gonna end up ruining my life.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Denise never wants to see me again.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What did you think was gonna happen?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I was sick of living a lie. Everybody loved me. Everybody looked up to me. But… I didn't deserve it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everybody makes mistakes. They just don't usually broadcast all of them at the same time.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Well, if I'm gonna die, I might as well do it with a clean soul.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And if you live? You didn't just burn bridges. You torched, nuked, and salted the earth with them.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Everybody has to pay for their sins. Oh, it feels like you stuck me with a hot poker.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: An allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's the swab for wheat-based allergies.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I've been eating wheat my entire life. I'm not allergic to wheat. Now it feels like my whole body's on fire.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This doesn't make any sense. He broke out with a rash right after I tested with the wheat-allergy swab, but none of his blood samples show he's allergic to it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then he's not allergic to it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could the corticosteroids have somehow caused it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't hook them up yet. After he broke out, I wanted to confirm it was gluten before we dosed him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be a latex allergy. Started with a condom, and we kept it going with our gloves and equipment.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He doesn't test positive for that either.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: None of his samples test positive for anything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then he's allergic to something not on the tests. I'll keep looking here.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We'll start the steroids and see if it clears up.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You have one patient and three DNA results?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How else do I compare them to other genetic disorders? What's up?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chase basically called me a sellout.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Just because you hung up your lab coat for more money and a bigger office?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I hung it up because someone had to run this place after Cuddy left.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are a lot of good administrators out there, not many good doctors.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: More to it than you think. For example, you're looking at monkey DNA. My analysis… House took your results after he manipulated you into providing them.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's shedding his skin like a snake.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If it was an allergic reaction, the corticosteroids and epinephrine would have made him better, not worse.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Is everyone trying to think of an answer? Or is everyone afraid to say

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I take it you're in the latter category.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Stevens-Johnson syndrome… it fits all of his symptoms and explains why he got worse after the steroids. Most medication exacerbates the condition.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's no treatment for it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It fits. Case closed. Why don't you go home and get some sleep?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I feel like I'm in hell.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can't give you too much pain medication, or we'll make your condition worse.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I got one final confession to make.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What's left… you cheated on your taxes?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I'm a murderer. I killed my business partner. I shot him in the head. I made it look like suicide. And he was just the first.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You killed more?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Three… or four.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Try not to kill anyone else until I get back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's neurological. There's an aneurysm in the anterior communicating artery of his brain… the area moderating impulse control and compulsion. As it grew larger, so did the confessions. Watch. Bob, one of my shoes is missing from my locker.

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: I'm so sorry. I… I needed the cash, and, um, the locker was open.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I never heard of a neurological problem that causes someone's skin to fall off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because there isn't one. The aneurysm is just another symptom. It's not the cause. You add them all together, we get… We get Kaw… Kawas… Kawas… It's Kawasaki's Disease. It's autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, we knew what "kawah" meant. We just figured since it basically presents only in Asian children…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which you might have, by the way. Which is basically why we missed it. Rug burns… certain carpet-cleaning chemicals have been linked to it. Start treatment with intravenous immunoglobulin. Monitor the aneurysm. If it doesn't resolve itself we'll have to repair it. The rest of you… aren't surfing enough.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Monkey DNA… nice touch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? You don't think I should have gone with rat? I've been second-guessing myself all day.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where are the DNA results?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: First admit that I was right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You manipulated me into doing it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I'll admit to that. Now you admit that it was incredibly easy, because you can't cheat an honest man.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I love them. I don't care if one of them isn't biologically mine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about both? Could be. Haven't read these. Now say I was right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. I'll admit I was weak for a moment, but I'm not doing this. I don't care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You do, and I'll prove it. I will shred this. I will call off my pool, return the money, and we'll forget all about it. Or we'll go to the light box in the lab and know the truth once and for all.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Stop. Let me see them. Just wanted to make sure all three were inside.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: The mayor checked. There wasn't any money missing from the scholarship fund. Dr. Chase told me… about your disease, how it made you confess to crimes you hadn't committed. The affair with that girl… is that real?

utterance.speaker: Bob
utterance.content: Honey, I… would never… have never cheated on you.

utterance.speaker: Denise
utterance.content: I knew you could never do that to me. I don't know how… but I knew.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Glad to see taking a year off didn't dull your skill set.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I got lucky.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: About the other night… I have enough problems with this job. Second-guessing my best doctors shouldn't be one of them.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why are you up here? You have your own bathroom and office now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shower. I haven't left the hospital in four days.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House won't go home. And there's no way I'm leaving him here unsupervised.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House is screwing with you… by not screwing with you. He's watching TV and drinking martinis all night. Meanwhile, he's keeping you here searching for a plan that doesn't even exist.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How the hell did I not see that? I'm glad you're back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Either a hot tub or a sauna.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: A hot tub would be cool.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: New team, old team… I present… Phase one of Operation Outer Office 2.0.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Nothing's changed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, everything has changed.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No.
